<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Right now, India’s Chandrayaan-2 mission is on its way to the moon for a scheduled landing in early September. As the NYT <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/22/world/asia/chandrayaan-india-moon-launch.html?utm_source=Eurasia+Group+Signal&utm_campaign=533db84cde-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_07_23_11_00&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_e605619869-533db84cde-170107393" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">points out</a>, with a total cost of less than $150 million, the mission was cheaper to produce than the movie <em>Interstellar</em>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On that note, have a great weekend.</p>
</td>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/26/four-automakers-come-agreement-california?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
California and Automakers Try to Clear the Air
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">California, as anyone who’s seen <em>Big Little Lies</em> will tell you, is car country. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And when you love something, you try to stop it from contributing to climate change. Yesterday, four large automakers (Ford, Honda, Volkswagen, and BMW) <a href="https://apnews.com/38cd5233db384285adb6a38bd3b58de0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">came to an agreement</a> with the California Air Resources Board to improve fuel efficiency in their fleets, bucking the Trump administration’s attempts to roll back emissions standards.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Like a kid who puts himself in time-out, these companies are signing up to be regulated more than is required. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And while those four automakers account for 30% of U.S. new vehicle sales, others are reportedly thinking about <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/25/climate/automakers-rejecting-trump-pollution-rule-strike-a-deal-with-california.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signing on</a> to the agreement. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">California vs. President Trump, part...we lost count </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a few weeks, Trump’s EPA is expected to roll out a plan that would undo Obama-era mileage targets—about 51 miles per gallon (mpg) for 2025 models—by freezing that target at about 37 mpg from 2020–2026. The California agreement is a rebuke to that rebuke. It proposes a slightly looser version of the Obama rule, requiring just under 50 mpg for 2026 models. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That California's making its own rules is ticking off the White House. <span>“The federal government, not a single state, should set this standard,” White House spokesman Judd Deere <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/auto-makers-agree-to-stricter-california-tailpipe-emissions-standards-11564074757?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>.</span></p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let's run through the different perspectives </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The White House’s argument:</strong> Because emissions standards may drive up prices, consumers will end up buying fewer new cars with the latest safety features. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">California’s view:</strong> Climate change is a pressing issue and the Trump plan doesn’t do enough to slow it down.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The industry’s perspective:</strong> Companies are caught in a regulatory tug-of-war between progressive states like California and a federal government that’s less concerned about vehicle emissions. With the agreement, these automakers are hoping to pressure Trump into making a deal with California. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Transportation is the single largest source of greenhouse gas emissions in the U.S., but reducing them will depend on resolving conflicting regulations. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F07%2F26%2Ffour-automakers-come-agreement-california" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=When+you+love+something%2C+you+try+to+stop+it+from+contributing+to+climate+change&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/26/four-automakers-come-agreement-california&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/26/apple-buys-intel-s-smartphone-modem-chip-unit?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple Declares Independence
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>When in the course of tech events, it becomes necessary for one company to sell a business unit to another for $1 billion…</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple is <a href="https://www.axios.com/apple-to-buy-intels-cellular-modem-business-9ca9c48b-e3c3-481d-b03d-88a9a3820be9.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acquiring</a> the majority of Intel’s smartphone-modem chip unit so it can eventually free itself from the tyrannical rule of buying someone else’s modem chips. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These are the components that go into your smartphone, connect to the mobile internet, and make life worth living. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The deal also means Apple will find desks for 2,200 loyalist Intel employees </span><span><a href="https://asia.nikkei.com/Spotlight/5G-networks/Apple-acquires-Intel-staff-and-patents-in-1bn-unit-purchase?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">and have 17,000</a></span><span> wireless technology patents at its disposal. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Intel’s smartphone operation was <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/intel-agrees-to-sell-smartphone-chip-assets-to-apple-11564086391?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">losing</a> about $1 billion annually. The death blow came in April, when Apple made up with longtime foe Qualcomm and started buying modems from the chipmaker. Apple had been Intel’s only major customer for that technology, so it was time to pack up. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Apple’s strategy can be <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-intel-divestiture-apple/apple-pays-1-billion-for-intel-unit-in-push-for-chip-independence-idUSKCN1UK2X3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">traced</a> to 2009, when Tim Cook channeled his inner Thomas Paine with some common sense wisdom: “We believe that we need to own and control the primary technologies behind the products that we make.”</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/26/ecb-lays-groundwork-stimulus-measures?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What's an ECB to Do?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A Frenchman <a href="https://apnews.com/581a158c4cf44caab3cd407fd0c15bd6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crashing into</a> the English Channel while crossing via hoverboard is the perfect metaphor for the European economy this week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Although European Central Bank (ECB) President Mario Draghi <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/25/business/european-central-bank-stimulus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">thinks</a> chances of a recession are “pretty low,” yesterday the ECB laid the groundwork for potential stimulus measures in its September meeting. These include an interest rate cut and buying corporate and government bonds (called “quantitative easing”).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What’s wrong: </strong></span><span>After a strong performance from 2015–2018, the eurozone’s economy is struggling. Export-dependent companies turned their focus to Asia, but that backfired when the U.S. and China started a trade war. Inflation is stuck below the target 2%, and don’t forget about Brexit.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Schwierigkeiten im Vaterland</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Germany is Europe’s biggest economy and exporter. Trouble in Deutschland = trouble for companies (and countries) feeding into its supply chain. In manufacturing, Germany’s <a href="https://www.ifo.de/en/node/44274?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">business climate index</a> “is in freefall” and hit its lowest point in more than nine years, according to the Ifo Institute.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Crazy stat:</strong> With a quarter the headcount, Germany produces nearly the same share of total world exports as the U.S., <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/europe-gets-caught-in-the-u-s-china-crossfire-11563980001?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/26/amazon-alphabet-report-mixed-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Internet Giants, They're Just Like Us
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What's more relatable than reporting quarterly sales in the tens of billions and dominating multiple industries at a time?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/25/amazon-earnings-q2-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">brought in</a> revenue of $63.4 billion last quarter, up 20% and beating forecasts. But shares dropped 1.6% after hours because it couldn’t keep its four-quarter streak of record profits going. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">We think we found the culprits: </strong></span><span>Amazon got hit with compensation-related expenses, plus it spent over $800 million in Q2 on investments in one-day free shipping for Prime members. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As for Alphabet, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/25/alphabet-q2-2019-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shares jumped</a> nearly 9% after hours after Google's parent company beat revenue and earnings expectations. Also helping: announcing a stock buyback of $25 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, traffic acquisition costs were less than analysts predicted. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Don’t speak Silicon Valley?</strong></span><span> Traffic acquisition costs = what Google pays hardware companies like Apple for Google to be the default search engine on their browsers. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, with Google’s roughly 90% market share in U.S. internet search, Alphabet’s <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/justice-department-is-preparing-antitrust-investigation-of-google-11559348795?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">very much</a> in U.S. and <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/20/eu-vestager-hits-google-with-fine-for.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">foreign</a> antitrust cops’ sights.</p>

<tr>

<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F07%2F26%2Famazon-alphabet-report-mixed-earnings" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/26/brew-s-weekly-news-quiz?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You Have GOT to Be Quizzing Me
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hotter than Europe. Always adjusts for inflation. Extern of the Year. It’s the Brew’s weekly news quiz. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. On Monday, 25 companies starting trading on a new stock venue in China, the country’s answer to the Nasdaq. What is the name of the exchange? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. Who agreed to pay the bigger fine this week, Equifax or Facebook? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. Until last harvest season, what apple had been the most-grown variety in the U.S. for 50 straight years? For 23 points of extra credit, name the apple variety that dethroned the king. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. Rank the following sports teams by valuation:</p>
<ol type="a">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>New England Patriots</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>New York Knicks</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dallas Cowboys</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Golden State Warriors</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. The U.K. has a new prime minister. What’s his name? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Answers: </em></strong><em>1) The STAR Market 2) Facebook, $5 billion versus up to $700 million 3) Red Delicious, extra credit answer is Gala 4) In descending order: Cowboys, Knicks, Patriots, Warriors 5) Boris Johnson  </em></sup></p>

sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nAUTO\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/26/four-automakers-come-agreement-california?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCalifornia and Automakers Try to Clear the Air\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCalifornia, as anyone who’s seen \u003cem\u003eBig Little Lies\u003c/em\u003e will tell you, is car country. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd when you love something, you try to stop it from contributing to climate change. Yesterday, four large automakers (Ford, Honda, Volkswagen, and BMW) \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/38cd5233db384285adb6a38bd3b58de0?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecame to an agreement\u003c/a\u003e with the California Air Resources Board to improve fuel efficiency in their fleets, bucking the Trump administration’s attempts to roll back emissions standards.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLike a kid who puts himself in time-out, these companies are signing up to be regulated more than is required. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd while those four automakers account for 30% of U.S. new vehicle sales, others are reportedly thinking about \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/25/climate/automakers-rejecting-trump-pollution-rule-strike-a-deal-with-california.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esigning on\u003c/a\u003e to the agreement. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCalifornia vs. President Trump, part...we lost count \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a few weeks, Trump’s EPA is expected to roll out a plan that would undo Obama-era mileage targets—about 51 miles per gallon (mpg) for 2025 models—by freezing that target at about 37 mpg from 2020–2026. The California agreement is a rebuke to that rebuke. It proposes a slightly looser version of the Obama rule, requiring just under 50 mpg for 2026 models. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat California's making its own rules is ticking off the White House. \u003cspan\u003e“The federal government, not a single state, should set this standard,” White House spokesman Judd Deere \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/auto-makers-agree-to-stricter-california-tailpipe-emissions-standards-11564074757?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet's run through the different perspectives \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe White House’s argument:\u003c/strong\u003e Because emissions standards may drive up prices, consumers will end up buying fewer new cars with the latest safety features. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCalifornia’s view:\u003c/strong\u003e Climate change is a pressing issue and the Trump plan doesn’t do enough to slow it down.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe industry’s perspective:\u003c/strong\u003e Companies are caught in a regulatory tug-of-war between progressive states like California and a federal government that’s less concerned about vehicle emissions. With the agreement, these automakers are hoping to pressure Trump into making a deal with California. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Transportation is the single largest source of greenhouse gas emissions in the U.S., but reducing them will depend on resolving conflicting regulations. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" href=\"https://asia.nikkei.com/Spotlight/5G-networks/Apple-acquires-Intel-staff-and-patents-in-1bn-unit-purchase?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eand have 17,000\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e wireless technology patents at its disposal. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIntel’s smartphone operation was \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/intel-agrees-to-sell-smartphone-chip-assets-to-apple-11564086391?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elosing\u003c/a\u003e about $1 billion annually. The death blow came in April, when Apple made up with longtime foe Qualcomm and started buying modems from the chipmaker. Apple had been Intel’s only major customer for that technology, so it was time to pack up. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong perfect metaphor for the European economy this week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAlthough European Central Bank (ECB) President Mario Draghi \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/25/business/european-central-bank-stimulus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethinks\u003c/a\u003e chances of a recession are “pretty low,” yesterday the ECB laid the groundwork for potential stimulus measures in its September meeting. These include an interest rate cut and buying corporate and government bonds (called “quantitative easing”).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s wrong: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter a strong performance from 2015–2018, the eurozone’s economy is struggling. Export-dependent companies turned their focus to Asia, but that backfired when the U.S. and China started a trade war. Inflation is stuck below the target 2%, and don’t forget about Brexit.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSchwierigkeiten im Vaterland\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGermany is Europe’s biggest economy and exporter. Trouble in Deutschland = trouble for companies (and countries) feeding into its supply chain. In manufacturing, Germany’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.ifo.de/en/node/44274?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebusiness climate index\u003c/a\u003e “is in freefall” and hit its lowest point in more than nine years, according to the Ifo Institute.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Crazy stat:\u003c/strong\u003e With a quarter the headcount, Germany produces nearly the same share of total world exports as the U.S., \u003ca Also helping: announcing a stock buyback of $25 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, traffic acquisition costs were less than analysts predicted. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli browsers. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, with Google’s roughly 90% market share in U.S.
